content.description: A different style of problem from the crimpy lines on the main face.
content.location: On the uphill corner of the boulder. SDS below the arete using a small dish for the RH and the LH in the hueco. Move up to a good pocket for the RH then traverse the arete to an easy top out.

content.description: A good companion line to the original Ant Farm problem. Crimpy.
content.location: Located on the left hand side of the face close to the corner. The start is kind of inobvious but look for 2 sidepull crimps about shoulder width apart. SDS then climb straight up using a small dish and crimps.

content.description: On the right hand side of the face. A fun problem on good but small holds.Â
content.location: SDS with RH in a sloper in the hueco and LH on a small white sidepull. Climb straight up using a sidepull pocket and a really nice incut crimp. Once the crimp is latched the original finish uses a good hold out right to link to the lip and topout. A direct finish was later added that goes straight to the lip from the crimp and probably pushes the difficulty to V4+.

content.description: This boulder features a nice gently overhanging face. The rock quality is some of the best in the canyon.
